message.content:
cs.RO, cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.SY. 

The paper deals with the problem of learning control policies for unmanned aerial vehicles (UAVs) to track a moving target. This problem is a classic one in robotics and falls under the category of robot control (cs.RO). The paper uses a convolutional neural network to represent the policy, which involves processing visual information from the UAV's camera. Therefore, the paper also falls under the category of computer vision (cs.CV). The paper proposes a hierarchical approach that combines a model-free policy gradient method with a conventional feedback proportional-integral-derivative (PID) controller to enable stable learning without catastrophic failure. This approach involves using reinforcement learning (RL) to learn the policy, which falls under the category of machine learning (cs.LG) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI). Finally, the paper deals with the problem of real-world UAV control, which involves dealing with safety-critical constraints and requires a data-efficient learning process. This problem falls under the category of control systems (cs.SY).
